intro: Astragalus gueldenstaedtiae, commonly known as the Guldental milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly Kazakhstan and western China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties.
